Hi Jim and Gordon, this is the reply from the owner

It's rather like a saucer. Flat on the other side, with the rim turned up. No detail at all on this side.

Rich


  Richard,
  It's one of the nanban types.  That style with the cupped shape and nunome
zogon is often labeled Hizen.  I don't recall seeing one made with two-layer
construction like that, though.  Does the other plate just cover the flat
area, or does it follow the cup all of the way to the rim?

  Jim
